cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 180 mi SSW of Panama City Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north through the northeast Gulf, turning northeast across the southeastern U.S. and then accelerating east-northeast off the Mid-Atlantic coast toward the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near Panama City / Mexico Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from South Santee River SC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Alabama/Florida border to Suwannee River FL; Tropical Storm Warning Alabama/Florida border westward to the MS/AL border and north of Fernandina Beach FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, Gulf states inland, Georgia, the Carolinas, Virginia and offshore Mid-Atlantic/New England waters
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible; probability of sustained tropical-storm-force winds only 4%
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in New York Harbor; surge confined to Southeast/Gulf coastlines
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Friday into Saturday as the post-tropical system passes offshore
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey and Long Island beaches Friday–Saturday
